ThingDef.label: agave fruit
ThingDef.description: Raw agave fruit.

ThingDef.label: berries
ThingDef.description: Assorted berries. Nice to eat, even when raw.

ThingDef.label: apples
ThingDef.description: A red fruit grow on trees.

ThingDef.label: banana
ThingDef.description: A yellow fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: grapes
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: orange
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: peach
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: pineapple
ThingDef.description: A tropical fruit having large swordlike leaves and a large, fleshy, edible, multiple fruit with a terminal tuft of leaves.

ThingDef.label: blueberry
ThingDef.description: Blue colored berry that grows in bushes. Even good raw.

ThingDef.label: watermelon
ThingDef.description: A large, roundish or elongated fruit of a trailing vine having a hard, green rind and a sweet, juicy, usually pink or red pulp.

ThingDef.label: date
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: fig
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: Cherries
ThingDef.description: A red berry fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: Coconut
ThingDef.description: A coconut fruit that grows on trees. Has a hard outer shell with a juicy fruit flesh inside.

ThingDef.label: bamboo
ThingDef.description: fast growing grass used for construction.

ThingDef.label: Ironwood
ThingDef.description: Ironwood is stronger and more beautiful then normal wood. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics. Very beautiful decorative material.

ThingDef.label: honey
ThingDef.description: Super sweet, super delicious, honey is used as a natural sweetener in all sorts of goodies. Also used in the production of mead. Doesn't spoil, though can deteriorate if left outside.

ThingDef.label: honey mead
ThingDef.description: Mead can taste good, but its main effect is intoxication. Excessive consumption can lead to alcohol blackouts and, over time, addiction.

ThingDef.label: red lentil
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich lentil. Used in place of meat in recipes.

ThingDef.label: mushroom
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich mushrooms. Nice to eat, even when raw.

ThingDef.label: garden fish
ThingDef.description: Fresh water small fish. Normally caught in shallow waters.

ThingDef.label: snow beet
ThingDef.description: Raw snow beet.

ThingDef.label: barley
ThingDef.description: Cereal grain used for livestock feed, cooked for food, and used for beer making.

ThingDef.label: bean
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways.

ThingDef.label: Olive
ThingDef.description: A small berry fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: cactus fruit
ThingDef.description: Raw cactus fruit.

ThingDef.label: coffee beans
ThingDef.description: Raw Coffee. Best prepared as a beverage

ThingDef.label: tea leaves
ThingDef.description: Tea leaves for brewing.

ThingDef.label: silage
ThingDef.description: Nutrient-rich fermented hay and grains for your animals. The fermentation process preserves the silage preventing rot.

ThingDef.label: biofuel
ThingDef.description: Fuel made from the processes of refining various types of plants for oils and alcohols. And is used to fuel generators and workbenches.

ThingDef.label: Hive piece
ThingDef.description: A living piece of an insect hive. Used to make a hydro-jelly farm to produce insect jelly. Eww I think it's still moving...

ThingDef.label: Garden Tea
ThingDef.description: A drink made from brew tea leaves.

ThingDef.label: Barley Tea
ThingDef.description: A drink made from brewed barley. \n\nDrink Effects: Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: Garden Coffee
ThingDef.description: A cup of coffee

ThingDef.label: fruit juice drink
ThingDef.description: A drink made from pressing fruit for their juice. \n\nDrink Effects: Consciousness and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: chocolate milk
ThingDef.description: Chocolate added to milk.

ThingDef.Name: MealbowlstewBase
ThingDef.description: A bowl of slow cooking stew. \n\nFood Effects: Consciousness, Metabolism, Blood Filtration, and Blood Pumping.

ThingDef.label: stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which variety of ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: vegetarian stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which vegetarian ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.
A complex dish assembled with care from vegetarian ingredients.

ThingDef.label: carnivore stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which meat ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: Hardtack
ThingDef.description: A simple type of biscuit. Tastes bland, but not offensive. Made from grains. It lasts a very long time without refrigeration. Great for travelling.

ThingDef.label: bamboomaker dryad
ThingDef.description: A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in bamboo production. Together with its Gauranlen tree, this dryad can generate a bamboo-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Gauranlen tree. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

ThingDef.label: ironwoodmaker dryad
ThingDef.description: A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in ironwood production. Together with its Gauranlen tree, this dryad can generate a ironwood-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Gauranlen tree. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

ThingDef.label: bamboo bonsai pot
ThingDef.description: This special pot is suitable for planting bamboo bonsai trees, which can improve the mood of people nearby and satisfy ideoligious requirements.

ThingDef.label: bonsai bamboo
ThingDef.description: A small bamboo tree, pruned and shaped to look visually pleasing.
